name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 1,3-oxazole, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methoxybenzylidene group (–O–C(=C)–) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The two phenyl groups (–Cc1ccc(OC)cc1–) contribute approximately +30 degrees Celsius each due to the enhancement of the π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. The methoxy group (–O–) adds approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. Finally, the carbonyl group (–C=O–) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the formation of hydrogen bonds and rigidity of the structure. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
